plugins.name: GIF Export (static or animated)
plugins.description:
Turn your designs into animated GIFs in just a few clicks.


This plugin is designed for designers who need to quickly export simple animations from multiple frames in Figma. With an intuitive interface, you can import your frames, adjust the time between frames, set compression, and create instant previews ‚Äî all without leaving Figma.


Ideal for creating animated banners, UI mockups, visual demos, and more. With compression support, local preview, and optimized export, you have full control over the final size and fluidity of your GIF.


Key features:


  1. Import multiple frames directly from Figma
  2. Configure delay between frames and infinite loop option
  3. Adjustable compression for quality and size control
  4. Preview directly in the plugin before exporting
  5. Local export with real-time preview


Lightweight, practical, and focused on productivity ‚Äî your shortcut to creating GIFs directly from Figma.
plugins.tagline: Export animated or static GIFs directly from Figma without complications.

plugins.name: Relinky - Scan and Replace Missing Tokens
plugins.description:
Relinky - Scan and Replace Missing Token


A powerful Figma plugin to help you find and manage unlinked design tokens and styles across your files. Inspired from other plugins like Similayer / Token studio


üîç Scan all unlinked values

- Typography: Find text layers missing text style variables

- Spacing: Detect auto-layout frames with unlinked spacing

- Corner Radius: Identify shapes with unlinked corner radius

- Fill Colors: Find layers with unlinked fill colors

- Stroke Colors: Detect layers with unlinked stroke colors


üéØ Smart Selection

  1. Scan entire page or selected frames/components
  2. Group similar unlinked values for easy selection
  3. Quick selection of affected layers
  4. Navigate to specific instances


Working with Results

  1. Results are grouped by type and value for easier management
  2. Click on any result to select the affected layers in your design
  3. Replace and update missing tokens and links!
  4. Use the navigation arrows to jump between instances
  5. Apply suggested styles directly from the results panel


Tips

  1. Use the grouped results to quickly standardize similar unlinked values
  2. Regular scanning helps maintain design system consistency
  3. Consider scanning before sharing designs or creating documentation

accepted.name: Ivan Yeo
accepted.description: Design system | Product designer | Badminton Lover

plugins.name: Frames to WebM
plugins.description:
Easily Create Lightweight WebM Animations from Figma Frames


'Frames to WebM' offers a simple and dependable way to convert your Figma frames into WebM animations. Designed for web designers and developers, this plugin makes it easy to generate high-quality, lightweight WebM exports directly from your Figma workflow. Whether you're adding motion graphics or upgrading from GIFs, this tool provides an efficient and reliable workflow.


How it works

  1. Select Frames: Choose any number of frames in your Figma document.
  2. Open the Plugin: Access 'Frames to WebM' and set up your project.
  3. Preview and Adjust: Fine-tune the timing of your animation with a live preview.
  4. Render and Download: Your WebM is rendered in the Cloud and ready to download in moments.


Why WebM?

  1. Efficient File Sizes: WebM delivers high-quality visuals with significantly smaller file sizes compared to GIFs.
  2. Better Performance: Optimized for the web, WebM ensures faster load times and smoother playback on modern browsers.
  3. Modern Format: WebM supports higher frame rates and better compression, making it a superior choice for animations.
plugins.tagline: Easily create animated WebM videos from Figma frames

plugins.name: Color Mate by UX mate
plugins.description:
Color Mate by UX Mate: Your Color Assistant in Figma


Struggling to create harmonious color palettes? Color Mate is here to be your color confidante in Figma! This user-friendly plugin takes the guesswork out of color selection, allowing you to generate beautiful and cohesive palettes based on a single chosen color.


Here's how Color Mate streamlines your design workflow:


Pick Your Perfect Base: Select any color that sparks your design inspiration ‚Äì it can be from your existing design or a new hue you've discovered.

Explore a Spectrum of Styles: Choose from various color scheme types like Monochromatic, Contrast, Triadic, and more, each offering a unique color harmony.

Fine-Tune Your Palette: Customize the palette by selecting variations like Pastel, Soft, Light, Hard, Pale, and others ‚Äì find the perfect balance for your design needs.

Generate Endless Possibilities: Need more palette options? No problem! Color Mate allows you to generate as many palettes as you desire until you find the perfect fit.

Seamless Integration: Once you're happy with your chosen palette, effortlessly create Figma Color Styles directly from the generated colors. This ensures consistent use of your chosen color scheme throughout your design.


With Color Mate, you can:


Save valuable design time: Stop wasting precious minutes mixing and matching colors ‚Äì Color Mate generates ready-to-use palettes in seconds.

Experiment with confidence: Explore diverse color harmonies without worrying about clashing colors.

Achieve design consistency: Create cohesive color schemes with ease thanks to Figma Style generation.

Color Mate by UX Mate ‚Äì Your key to effortless and beautiful color palettes in Figma!

plugins.name: Wireframeit Plugin
plugins.description:
Transform live websites and HTML into fully editable designs or low-fidelity wireframes. Wireframeit accurately captures the layout, typography, and structure of any site and converts it into editable design files ready to export directly to Figma.


Use the browser extension to scan a live website, export it as a .wfit file, and import it into Figma using this plugin. You'll get clean frames, layout structure, and text boxes, no screenshots, no messy code.


How to use it:

  1. Install the Wireframeit browser extension.
  2. Click the extension on any website ‚Üí Export ‚Üí Figma.
  3. Download the .wfit file.
  4. Open Figma ‚Üí run the Wireframeit plugin.
  5. Drag in the file, hit Import, and start editing.
plugins.tagline: Convert any website into editable Figma designs or wireframes

plugins.name: Export local variables to Json
plugins.description:
Plugin Overview

This plugin takes Local Variables of Figma and outputs them as a JSON file in Style Dictionary format. This allows design tokens to be efficiently reflected in the code.


Main Functions

1. Get Local Variables

- Color values

- Spacing

- Typography

and other variables are automatically retrieved


2. Maintain hierarchical structure

// Maintain Figma structure (e.g.colors/primary/base) in JSON format
{
"colors": {
"primary": {
"base": {
"$value": "#1a2b3c",
"$type": "color"
}
}
}
}


3. Value Conversion

- Colors: Convert from RGBA to HEX format

- Numbers: Manage decimal precision

- Variable references: Properly resolve aliases


How to Use

1. Launch the plugin in Figma

2. Click the "Export" button

3. Download the generated JSON file


Features

- JSON output compliant with Style Dictionary format

- Simple UI

- Error fallback handling

- Comprehensive validation


Applications

- Design system construction

- Batch management of design tokens

- Synchronization with codebase


This plugin enables seamless bridging between design and code.
plugins.tagline: you can export all local variables as json

Start using Heuristic Checker today to streamline your design QA process and deliver pixel-perfect designs with confidence.

117258.release_notes:
# Heuristic Checker v0.2.0 Release Notes
January 27, 2025

## üéâ New Features

### Icon Contrast Improvements
- Enhanced icon contrast validation with role-based requirements
- Improved opacity handling for layered icons
- Added support for interactive, informative, and decorative icon roles
- Implemented proper color blending calculations for accurate contrast measurement

### Color Utilities
- Added new color utility functions for precise color manipulation
- Implemented linear RGB color space calculations for accurate blending
- Added support for hex color conversion and contrast ratio calculation

## üîß Improvements

### Accessibility Compliance
- Updated contrast ratio calculations to strictly follow WCAG 2.1 guidelines
- Enhanced focus state detection and validation
- Improved disabled state analysis with multiple detection methods

plugins.name: MotionPoint Translator
plugins.description:
Overview

Unlock the full potential of your Figma designs with our state-of-the-art plugin. Designed for seamless integration, this tool brings professional translation services into your Figma workflow, automating the creation of translated versions of your designs.


Seamless Integration

Bridge the gap between design and global communication by automating the generation of translated Figma designs. Our plugin ensures your UI/UX resonates with audiences worldwide, offering both human and machine translation options.


Simple Steps to Localization

Language Selection: Start by choosing the languages you want to translate your design into, ensuring a wide-reaching impact.

Translation Quality: Select the desired level of translation quality‚Äîopt for Human Translation for nuanced accuracy or Machine Translation for swift turnaround.

Translation Progress: Monitor the translation's progress with ease. Our plugin keeps you updated every step of the way.

Import Translations: Once translations are complete, import them directly from the Progress tab or use the Import tab to generate the translated designs for all selected languages


Effortless Process

With minimal effort, watch as your Figma projects elevate to an international standard. Our plugin simplifies the complexities of localization, letting you focus on what you do best: creating stunning, culturally resonant designs.
plugins.tagline: Seamlessly bridge Figma to professional translation, automating your content localization.

plugins.name: CopyGlyphs
plugins.description:
CopyGlyphs delivers the easiest way to work with special characters in Figma. Explore the world of glyphs, ligatures, emojis, and other symbols directly in Figma using the CopyGlyphs plugin.


Key features

  1. 100+ glyphs
  2. Search functionality
  3. Fully keyboard controllable
  4. Available in Figma
  5. Dark mode support


How to use

  1. Click to copy any glyph and paste it wherever you want in Figma.
  2. Copy the glyph directly to your clipboard for seamless pasting.


Warning

Some fonts may not include all Unicode characters. If a pasted glyph doesn't appear correctly, the font likely doesn't support that character.
plugins.tagline: Browse, search, & copy symbols or special characters quickly with CopyGlyphs‚Äîeffortless & efficient.

plugins.name: ark-tailwind-codegen
plugins.description:
This plugin is based on Parbez's figma-tailwindcss plugin


It uses ARK's custom Tailwind theme to convert Figma's CSS output into tailwind classes that can be used in conjunction with our design system.


The source code is available on Github


How to use

  1. Click the Open in... button and choose the file you want to use it in
  2. Go to your file and make sure you‚Äôre in Dev Mode (if there are green buttons in the UI, you‚Äôre in the right place üëå)
  3. Select the layers you want to generate the class names for
  4. Make sure you have the Inspect panel open on the right-hand side
  5. Scroll down to the 'tailwindcss' section et voil√† ‚ú®


  1. If you don‚Äôt see this section but instead see an Inspect layer properties button, click it and you should see that section appear
  2. If you still can‚Äôt see the section, make sure you‚Äôve got `ark-tailwind-code` plugin selected from dropdown at the top-right of the `Code` section


Todo

  1. [ ] Import tailwind theme from @ark/theming
  2. [ ] Custom typography classes
  3. [ ] Convert layout variables to classes
  4. [ ] Prettier?
plugins.tagline: Convert Figma's css output into tailwind classes that match our custom theme.

plugins.name: Hide/Delete All Grid Layouts
plugins.description:
On the current Figma version, when you select multiple frames, with different layout grids applied, you don't have options to hide, show or delete their layout grids.


This plugin lets you hide, show, or delete layout grids on the selected frames (or components). You can apply to all frames on the current page.


Features

  1. Hide, show or delete layout grids on all frames and components (also nested frames) on the current page
  2. Select multiple frames to hide, show or delete them.


Quick Actions

  1. Open
  2. Hide Grids
  3. Show Grids
  4. Hide Selected Grids
  5. Show Selected Grids


Pricing

  1. Hiding, Showing and Deleting layout grids on the current page are FREE.
  2. A one-time purchase to hide, show and delete the selected frames.
plugins.tagline: Hide Show or Delete Layout Grids for Frames

plugins.name: Huima
plugins.description:
Huima


Translate designs into development-ready code at lightning speed


Let me automatically handle the tedious task of comparing and reproducing dull design drafts! Export UI-consistent, clean, and tidy frontend code with just one click, allowing frontend engineers to focus on dynamic design and business logic development.


The project is currently in development, and many features may not be stable. If you encounter any bugs or have something to tell us, feel free to leave a message in the GitHub issue. Yes, the code is also there, it's open source.


Features


  • Export page code and static resources that match the design draft with a single click.
  • Support for automatic layout and generation of positioning styles.
  • Support for copying code of any node online.
  • Support for responsive layout units such as rem and vw.
  • Support for partial tailwindcss style conversion.
  • Support for online preview, including font styles.
  • Support for converting styles of most node types to the web environment.


Design Conventions


Converting designs accurately into code is a challenging task that often requires close collaboration between designers and developers, fully understanding the working methods and limitations of each tool.


  • Rotation is not currently supported.


Rendering Conventions


To generate more concise code, the following conventions are applied during rendering:


  • When rendering groups, only the outermost group is rendered by default if nested.
plugins.tagline: Translate designs into development-ready code at lightning speed

plugins.name: OKLCH Color Ramp
plugins.description:
Overview

The OKLCH Color Ramp Generator is a powerful Figma plugin designed to help designers create beautiful, perceptually uniform color scales using the OKLCH color space. This innovative tool addresses the common challenge of creating consistent and visually pleasing color ramps in design systems.


Key Features


1. Advanced Color Space Implementation

- Utilizes the OKLCH color space, which offers superior color interpolation compared to traditional RGB or HSL

- Ensures perceptually uniform steps between colors, making the resulting ramps more visually harmonious

- Provides more accurate color relationships, especially important for accessibility and design system consistency


2. User-Friendly Interface

- Simple and intuitive input system for base colors

- Customizable number of steps in the color ramp (default: 12)

- One-click generation of complete color scales


3. Smart Layout and Organization

- Automatically arranges color swatches in a horizontal layout

- Includes color information display (hex codes and intended OKLCH values)

- Automatic selection and zoom to the generated color ramp

- Clean, organized presentation of color information


Benefits for Designers


1. Time Efficiency

- Rapid generation of color scales

- Eliminates manual color interpolation

- Reduces the chance of errors in color calculations


2. Design Quality

- Ensures consistent visual steps between colors

- Creates more accessible color combinations

- Maintains color harmony across the design system


3. Workflow Integration

- Seamlessly fits into existing Figma workflows

- Provides immediate visual feedback

- Easy to iterate and adjust color scales


Future Development

The plugin is actively maintained with planned improvements:

- Enhanced color information display

- Additional customization options for color ramp generation

- Request feature in comments
plugins.tagline: Generate stunning, perceptually uniform color ramps effortlessly.

plugins.name: Vector to Rectangle
plugins.description:
The Problem

When importing Illustrator files into Figma, rectangles often get converted to vector shapes, losing their adjustable properties like corner radius. This can be a huge headache, especially when dealing with numerous elements.


The Solution

This plugin automatically converts these vectorized rectangles back into native Figma rectangles, preserving their adjustable properties.


Key Features

  1. Automatically detects vectorized rectangles from Illustrator imports
  2. Converts vectors to native Figma rectangles with editable properties
  3. Preserves corner radii and other rectangle attributes
  4. Batch processing for multiple elements at once
  5. Significant time-saver for designers.
plugins.tagline: Converts messed up vectors to rectangles.

plugins.name: Text Case Converter
plugins.description:
Time to jazz up your designs! Select your artboards or text layers, launch the plugin, and voila! Instantly convert them to sentence case or title case.


Got words that need a special treatment? Pop 'em into the Preserved Terms list and watch the magic happen!


Plugin ignores words in FULL CAPS to avoid messing up acronyms.


Note: When multiple colors or text styles are present within a text layer, the plugin will apply the color/style of the first character to the entire text layer.
plugins.tagline: Convert text layers in the selected artboards to sentence case or title case

  3. Wrap items
  4. Fixed gap between items
  5. Auto gap between items
  6. Horizontal resizing hug
  7. Horizontal resizing fill

  9. Vertical resizing hug
  10. Vertical resizing fill

Plugins->Saved plugins->Auto Layout Keyboard Shortcuts->Vertical layout

plugins.name: DoujinFigma
plugins.description:
# Doujin Figma - A Figma Plugin that help you make your own drawing with Stable Diffusion using Colab


Free and open source plugin for you to use Figma with Stable Diffusion.

Made this plugin for my friends so that it is easier for them to draw their Dojin Manga.

I made another Design Assistant which is called Design Wingman but it is harder to setup.

While this plugin is easier to setup.


- [x] Text to Image

- [x] Image to Image

- [x] Inpaint

- [x] Remove Background

- [ ] Segment Anything

- [x] Support Colab

- [x] Support Localhost

- [ ] Support Free to use Demo (No Localhost nor Colab needed)


## Installation

plugins.name: CSS/SCSS Variables Colorizer
plugins.description:
Usage

  1. Copy the base CSS or SCSS variable code.
  2. Launch the plugin.
  3. Paste the code into the input field of the plugin UI.
  4. Click the button.
  5. The plugin generates code where the color variables with the same name as Figma variables are set to the colors of those variables.

For example, you can input next code.

// CSS variables
--primaryColor: #ffffff;
--secondaryColor: #000000;

// SCSS variables
$primaryColor: #ffffff;
$secondaryColor: #000000;
plugins.tagline: Smoothly integrate Figma colors into your CSS/SCSS variables.

plugins.description:
Simplify your workflow - transform designs into documentation.

Quickly generate precise specs for each selected layer, streamlining communication with developers.

  1. selection indicators
  2. padding visuals

  4. layer analysis


We're just getting started‚Äîstay tuned for customizable settings and an in-depth guide.

98085.name: Spectacle
98085.description:
Simplify your workflow - transform designs into documentation.

Quickly generate precise specs for each selected layer, streamlining communication with developers.


Features include:

  1. selection indicators
  2. padding visuals
  3. detailed attribute lists
  4. layer analysis


We're just getting started‚Äîstay tuned for customizable settings and an in-depth guide.


We value your feedback‚Äîlet us know how we can make Spectacle even better.
98085.release_notes:
Welcome to the latest release of Spectacle. This update brings you powerful enhancements to document generation, improved handling of auto layout properties, and better error management.

Key Highlights:

Improvements were made to the stacking order of elements in generated specification documents and enhances the handling of layout attributes for nodes with ‚ÄúFill‚Äù and ‚ÄúStretch‚Äù properties. Additionally, significant code refactoring has been done to streamline document generation, improve error handling, and ensure more reliable output.
  - Corrected Element Stacking Order: Refined the stacking order logic to ensure that layer badges, numbers, headers, and attributes are displayed in the correct sequence within the generated specification documents.
  - Improved Handling of Auto Layout Properties: Enhanced support for nodes with "Fill" and "Stretch" properties to accurately reflect these attributes in the generated documents.
  - Enhanced Error Handling: Added more robust error handling during document generation, allowing for better diagnostics and stability.
  - Modularized Code Structure: Refactored the codebase to improve maintainability and performance by splitting functionality into well-organized modules.
  - Automatic Selection Handling: Updated the selection management to automatically handle node selection changes more efficiently.

---

Bug Fixes:

Resolved an issue where the plugin did not correctly detect the initial selection upon opening.

Updated the plugin to accurately detect and display the selection count both upon initialization and whenever the selection changes.

All layers are now properly analyzed and included in the generated documentation. However, there are still issues with some attributes not being listed and empty layers being unnecessarily analyzed. These will be addressed in the next release.

---

Code Improvement:

Modularized Code Structure: The codebase has been significantly refactored to enhance maintainability and performance. Key components, such as badges, overlays, padding visuals, and text elements, have been separated into distinct modules within the¬†`components`folder. This modular approach facilitates easier updates and better code organization.

Optimized Auto Layout Handling: The new¬†`fitNodeToContainer`¬†function within the¬†`Container.ts`¬†module ensures that nodes with "layoutGrow" and "layoutAlign" properties are correctly resized based on their parent's dimensions, providing a more accurate reflection of the design intent.

---

Enhanced Error Handling:

Layer Processing Error Management: The¬†`generateDocumentStructure`¬†function in¬†`docHandler.ts`¬†now includes try-catch blocks to handle errors during the processing of each layer. This ensures that the document generation process continues even if an issue occurs with a specific layer, with errors being logged for debugging purposes.

Improved Debugging Information: Additional logging has been introduced to capture more detailed information about the layer processing, aiding in troubleshooting and ensuring smoother operation.

---

Breaking Changes and Known Issues:

Preview Functionality: The preview feature is currently broken and does not display anything. We are aware of this issue and are actively working on a fix, which will be included in the next release.

Incomplete Attribute Listings: While all layers of a selection are now included in the documentation creation, some attributes are still not being listed, and empty layers are being analyzed. This is a known issue that will be addressed in the next update.

plugins.name: SimpleLocalize: Localization plugin for multi-language design
plugins.description:
Simplify your app localization workflow right from Figma.


SimpleLocalize for Figma helps you preview your designs in multiple languages with just a few clicks. Connect your project to pull translations directly from SimpleLocalize and see how your UI looks in different languages, right inside Figma.


Quick start:

  1. Create SimpleLocalize project, add languages
  2. Open up SimpleLocalize plugin in Figma
  3. Select text elements
  4. Hit "Push translations"
  5. Auto-translate texts
  6. Change the language in Figma plugin and hit "Pull translations"
  7. Done!


Automatically generate translation keys with screenshots, and upload new or updated text back to your SimpleLocalize project. No more manual work or version confusion.

Whether you're building global products or collaborating with localization teams, SimpleLocalize makes it easy to manage translations during the design stage.


If you have any issues or suggestions, hit us up on figma@simplelocalize.io or create an issue here: https://simplelocalize.io/feature-requests
plugins.tagline: Localization made simple for global design

plugins.name: Figma Time Tracker
plugins.description:
Have you ever lost track of time while working in Figma? Our time-tracking plugin is designed to solve this problem.


This plugin allows you to automatically track the time you spend actively working in Figma by recording your interactions based on actions such as cursor movement and document changes. It‚Äôs an ideal solution for designers and teams who need to accurately track their time without manual interruptions.


Key Features:


Automatic activity tracking:

  1. The plugin starts tracking time automatically while you interact with the project.
  2. It records actions such as element selection and document changes.


Automatic pause on inactivity:

  1. If there is no activity for 30 seconds, the timer pauses automatically.
  2. It resumes as soon as it detects movement or actions in the file.


Minimalist and floating interface:

  1. Compact size to avoid interfering with your workspace.
  2. Can be freely moved across the screen for convenience.


Tracking control:

  1. A single button to manually pause and resume tracking when needed.


Time tracking in seconds and minutes:

  1. Clear and precise display of elapsed time on the interface.


This plugin is designed to help designers focus on what really matters‚Äîcreativity‚Äîwhile time tracking is handled automatically and effortlessly.


Optimize your workflow and manage your time more effectively with our Figma tracking plugin!
plugins.tagline: Optimize your work time in Figma with automatic activity tracking.
